attributes.title: Nestle Purelife Water Bottle
attributes.description: An overview of the path traveled by a Nestle PureLife water bottle.

attributes.address: 335 S Red Bank Rd, Evansville, IN 47712, USA
attributes.title: Evansville Wal Mart

attributes.description: The water bottle was made in North America and is made out of polyethylene. Factory machines mold the bottle into its final shape, and it is shipped from the headquarters to retailers across the country, such as Wal Mart.  Water bottles in general can be used a great number of times, or only once.  Once used, this water bottle can be easily recycled due to its status as a number 1 plastic.  Recycling is a simple process, and nearly everyone has access to the means to recycle a number 1 plastic, so this process really should occur anytime one uses a Nestle Purelife water bottle.
attributes.title: Nestle Purelife Waters North America
Nestle Purelife Waters North America to Evansville Wal Mart
attributes.description: This is the Wal Mart where the bottle was purchased.  It travels here from Stamford, CT and is purchased by consumers.  The consumers drink the water from the bottle and hopefully reuse it a number of times before recycling it.
